## Bio

Sandeep M. Nayak, MD, is an Assistant Professor of Psychiatry at Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine and Medical Director of the Center for Psychedelic & Consciousness Research.

Dr. Nayak's research focuses on the clinical applications and methodological challenges of psychedelic medicine. He is particularly interested in testing and improving psychedelics for various psychiatric indications especially addictions and mood disorders. He currently serves as Principal Investigator for three clinical trials investigating psilocybin for opioid use disorder, PTSD, and microdosing safety. He also works on behavioral pharmacology of psychedelics, psychotherapy/psychological support, belief changes, and cross-cultural effects of psychedelics. He has personally conducted several dozen high-dose psilocybin sessions and overseen hundreds. He has worked on more than a dozen clinical trials of various psychedelics in patient populations.

He earned his MD from Brown University and completed psychiatry residency at Johns Hopkins Hospital, followed by a postdoctoral fellowship with Roland Griffiths. He is also a practicing psychiatrist at Johns Hopkins Bayview Medical Center with clinical interests in behavioral disorders, mood disorders and catatonia.

Sandeep is currently Principal Investigator of three clinical trials:

-   [BIPOD](https://hopkinspsychedelic.org/opioiduse): a randomized trial of psilocybin for Opioid Use Disorder with buprenorphine

-   [Pilot study of psilocybin for PTSD](https://hopkinspsychedelic.org/ptsdstudy)

-   [Microdose psilocybin safety study](https://hopkinspsychedelic.org/microdose) in healthy volunteers
